bib_record.title: Spallation and fission yields in the interactions of tantalum, tungsten and gold with 500-MeV protons.

free_txt: .Synchrotron at the National Laboratory
For High Energy Physics,Japan (KEK).
Mass-Yield Distributions were Compared with the
Existing Data.
-By Compiler- Authors did not present decay data of
investigated radioactive decays. Therefore some
ambiguities are possible.
.A 85 cm**3 Ge(LI) detector.
The quoted errors include estimated
uncertainties of the detection efficiency of the gamma-
rays and statistical uncertainties for photo-yields.
Possible errors in the branching ratios of the gamma-
rays9) and systematic uncertainties due to the beam
intensity calibration are not included
.Synchrotron at the National Laboratory
For High Energy Physics,Japan (KEK).
The stacks were repeatedly measured over a period of
seven months.
The Measuring time was increased from 30 min at the
beginning of the measurements to several days.
.For gold target.
They are in general agreement with the present results,
but their data for a few heavy nuclides tend to be
larger by about 20%.
A Stack of thin metal foils of fifteen elements was
irradiated.
The  target samples of tantalum, tungsten and gold were
placed at the downstream  end  of  the  stack  in  this
order.
The thicknesses of the three target samples with
natural abundance were about 40 mg/cm**2 each and each
sample was guarded with adjacent identical foils in
order to minimize scattering-in and scattering-out
effects. The total thickness of the target stack was
about 1 g/cm**2.
